content.description: Best if done at night.  Downclimb the route to get down.  Start in front of the young men's christian association.  Pick a flag pole and climb it.  Run right and jump for an angled steel beam.  Use this beam to reach either of the two edges above the beams and then mantel.  Beware of pipes laying approx. five inches above the ground on the roof.  Travers across the roof towards the roof for Hannafords.
content.protection: Well... none really, this route has two ten foot pitches with little chance for a rough fall.
content.location: The route is on the young men's christian association.

content.description:
Go to the back of the IGA building.  Look for the large metal staircase.  Once you're on top of the stairs, use the hinges/doorknob and railing to ascend the additional 6 ' to the actual roof.  Easy, and short.   

  NOTE:  It would be possible to go from the backside of the railing and jump to a cat-grab on the wall next to the stairs.  This has not been done yet.
content.protection: No crash pad necessary.  (May want a crash pad for the optional cat-grab)
content.location: Get down by lowering off the edge of the roof and finding the holds with your feet, or just dropping onto the large platform.

content.description: Not secluded, but less likely to be spotted than most areas in Bangor due to the smaller amound of people.  Weather is the same as the Bangor area.
